page.title: 06FARMING, MEREACRE ESTATE
page.content: Mereacre Estate comprises a few farms,but the majority of the land comes from the old Longwood Estate. There are many trees on the Estate. Oak trees are not common, a few oak trees are sent to the woodmills to be made into furniture. Elms are also scarce because of a disease. A small bug gets into the heart of the wood of the tree and the tree disintergrates into a fine dust. The elms are sprayed with chemicals in an attempt to preserve the trees. Hazel and ash trees grow the best on the chalk soil. The Mereacre Estate look after their trees well, and have a programme of re-planting.
